abstract: Federal health officials recommend people infected with HIV be immediately put on antiretroviral drugs upon diagnosis, since those who receive immediate treatment are 53 percent less likely to develop AIDS or serious illness; halt clinical trial on early treatment led by National Institute for Allergy and Infectious Disease because results were overwhelmingly clear.
lead_paragraph: Federal health officials announced the new guidelines after a clinical trial showed pronounced benefits for people put on antiretroviral drugs as soon as they learned they were infected.

headline.main: H.I.V. Treatment Should Start at Diagnosis, U.S. Health Officials Say
headline.print_headline: Scientists Urge a Prompt Start of H.I.V. Drugs
